clinical_study.brief_title: Feasibility Study of a Molecular Karyotype Using a Very High-throughput Sequencing Approach, the "Massive Parallel Sequencing" on Circulating Tumor DNA
clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility Study of a Molecular Karyotype Using a Very High-throughput Sequencing Approach, the "Massive Parallel Sequencing" on Circulating Tumor DNA

brief_summary.textblock:
There are several types of circulating DNA: DNA from patient's existing cells, foetal DNA in the case of pregnant woman, and tumoral DNA in the case of patients with cancer. These circulating tumoral DNA (ctDNA) can be obtained from a blood test called liquid biopsy and be detected by the latest generation of very high throughput sequencers with the Massive Parallel Sequencing technique (MPS).
This study focus on using this technique on breast and colorectal cancers in which no analysis of CNV (tumor origin marker) with this technique has been performed yet. It is a prospective, pilot, monocentric, feasibility study on genomic profile. The study aim is to show the possibility to realize in a reproductive way a molecular karyotype on ctDNA with the MPS approach from a liquid biopsy taken from patients with cancer and to compare this profile with the one obtained by CGH array (Comparative Genomic Hybridization) from primitive tumor.

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility of molecular karyotype performed from liquid biopsy: copies number variations (CNV)
primary_outcome.description: Feasibility of molecular karyotype showing acquired copies number variations (CNV) on whole genome performed from ctDNA isolated from blood sample in patients with breast or colorectal cancer

secondary_outcome.measure: Identification of patient's tumor genomic profile with blood sample
secondary_outcome.description: Identification of patient's tumor genomic profile by comparison between genomic profile of primitive tumor obtained by CGH array and genomic profile of ctDNA obtained by Massive Parallel Sequencing

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients with breast or colorectal cancer
arm_group.description: 10 patients with invasive breast carcinoma, not otherwise specified (NOS) (Stade I to III) and 10 patients with invasive colorectal adenocarcinoma (Stade I to III)

intervention.arm_group_label: Patients with breast or colorectal cancer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age > 18 years
- Signed consent
- Women with invasive breast carcinoma, NOS, with a radiologically measurable tumor of more than 10 mm (stade I to III)
- Patients with invasive colorectal adenocarcinoma with a radiologically measurable tumor of more than 10 mm (stade I to III)
- Patients who primary surgery is planned
Exclusion Criteria:
- Neoadjuvant chemotherapy or neoadjuvant radiotherapy
- Other cancer
- BMI > 30
- Pregnant woman
- Patients under protective administration or deprived of liberty
